discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
"You cannot send backups to one remote system and reports to another, but you can choose to send either to a remote system and store the other on the Firepower Management Center."

Option A, B, and D are valid answers. However the keyword is "...to be used with their Active Directory Logins". Since SMB and Active Directory are BOTH Microsoft developed technologies for the sake of interoperability I will go with answer D (use SMB for both backups and reports.)

Selected Answer: C
Using SMB for both backups and reports, is a valid approach for providing access to both backups and reports. However, it may not be the best choice if you want to separate the storage of backups and reports for security and disaster recovery reasons.

The scenario in the question specifies different objectives for configuration backups and reports:

Configuration Backups: These need to be available from a secure location on the network for disaster recovery. Using SMB for backups can provide this secure storage.

Reports: Auditors need to access reports with their Active Directory logins. This requirement is well-suited for using NFS, as it allows for easy access control and integrates with Active Directory for authentication.

While using SMB for both purposes is possible, it may not provide the same level of granularity and access control for reports as NFS integrated with Active Directory.

So option C is a more flexible choice that aligns with the specific requirements of the scenario.

comments.content:
I take it back, answer would be D:

"You cannot send backups to one remote system and reports to another, but you can choose to send either to a remote system and store the other on the Firepower Management Center."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/firepower/640/configuration/guide/fpmc-config-guide-v64/system_configuration.html

choices.C: Use SMB for backups and NFS for reports.
choices.D: Use SMB for both backups and reports.
choices.A: Use NFS for both backups and reports.
choices.B: Use SSH for backups and NFS for reports.

questions.question_text: An engineer needs to configure remote storage on Cisco FMC. Configuration backups must be available from a secure location on the network for disaster recovery. Reports need to back up to a shared location that auditors can access with their Active Directory logins. Which strategy must the engineer use to meet these objectives?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
failover ipsec pre-shared-key *****

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/firepower-management-center/212699-configure-ftd-high-availability-on-firep.html

By default, the communications on the failover and stateful failover links are plain text (unencrypted). You can encrypt the communications for enhanced security by configuring an IPsec encryption key. You can use any unused data physical interfaces as the failover link and optional dedicated state link.

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring two new Cisco FTD devices to replace the existing high availability firewall pair in a highly secure environment. The information exchanged between the FTD devices over the failover link must be encrypted. Which protocol supports this on the Cisco FTD?

Step 5 :Add a High Availability Pair.

choices.C: The FTD configuration must be converted to ASA command format, which can then be migrated to FMC.
choices.A: The current FDM configuration must be configured by hand into FMC before the devices are registered.
choices.D: The current FDM configuration will be converted automatically into FMC when the device registers.
choices.B: The current FDM configuration must be migrated to FMC using the Secure Firewall Migration Tool.

questions.question_text: A consultant is working on a project where the customer is upgrading from a single Cisco Firepower 2130 managed by FDM to a pair of Cisco Firepower 2130s managed by FMC for high availability. The customer wants the configuration of the existing device being managed by FDM to be carried over to FMC and then replicated to the additional device being added to create the high availability pair. Which action must the consultant take to meet this requirement?
